title: Find Common Elements in Nested Lists
description: From a list of integers, remove all elements that occur more than once. Keep order of elements left the same as in the input.
prompt:
from typing import List

def remove_duplicates(numbers: List[int]) -> List[int]:
    """ From a list of integers, remove all elements that occur more than once.
    Keep order of elements left the same as in the input.
    >>> remove_duplicates([1, 2, 3, 2, 4])
    [1, 3, 4]
    """
    pass
test_code:
def test_remove_duplicates():
    assert remove_duplicates([]) == []
    assert remove_duplicates([1, 2, 3, 4]) == [1, 2, 3, 4]
    assert remove_duplicates([1, 2, 3, 2, 4, 3, 5]) == [1, 4, 5]
reference_solution:
from typing import List
from collections import Counter

def remove_duplicates(numbers: List[int]) -> List[int]:
    c = Counter(numbers)
    return [n for n in numbers if c[n] <= 1]
